seg.output: Now that the messenger had been prepared for his journey and I could no longer delay, I could not conceal from you, beloved brother, what is openly circulated through all the villages, namely that the Glarona community had requested the 5 parishes and had proposed to them what they should demand so that they would keep their agreements and remain in their ancient religion, which they have not done so far, even though they have often promised it. Nor is there any danger in this. For the Zurich people have only promised that they will recall their old religion a little later. The Bernese also hope for something similar. But the Glarona people have kindly received the ambassadors without giving a response, and will soon respond after maturely considering each thing. These rumors are so certain among us that nothing is more certain, but many believe that what you have promised is a deception and lie, with which they want to ensnare and persuade the pious Glarona people. Therefore I beg that you should investigate among your people whether they are convinced of that Antroniorum mission.

seg.output: Oh my Heinric, how in great danger is our state! Wingarterus has been removed for fornication, then 5 others, and two are completely ill and elderly. Therefore, eight need to be added to the senate. There are many wise old men and of some authority, but in whom it is not easy to trust the business of Christ. Then there are young men, indeed pious, but imprudent, avaricious and of no authority. Unless the Lord pours out His goodness in the election of magistrates upon us, it will be easily done with us. Pray to God, and let your church pray for us. The first of April is the election of those who elect deacons and the senate, the second the election of deacons, the sixth of consuls, the fourth of panderers, the seventh of the lesser senate. Farewell. May you all be safe. Yours, Bert. H. To Heinric Bullinger, Tigurine ecclesiast, his most dear brother.
